text:
Transportation, Trolley (horse drawn): The Bleecker Street and Broadway Line on its last run, photographed on Bleecker Street, at Mercer Street. Note Macfaddens Physical Culture Restaurant at the N.E. corner of that point. An account of this was carried in the New York Times of July 27, 1917 on Page 18:3.

July 27, 1917.
title: Transportation - Trolley - Horse drawn street car.

text:
Transportation, Trolley (horse drawn): The Bleecker Street and Broadway Line, photographed on Bleecker Street, at Mercer Street. This undoubtedly is a ceremony attendant to the last run. Note Macfadden's Physical Culture Restaurant occupying the store at the N.E. corner of the aforementioned point. For a detailed account of this last trip see the New York Times of July 27, 1917, Page 18:3.

July 27, 1917.
title: Transportation - Trolley - Horse drawn street car.

text:
200 Mercer Street (shown on some maps as 198), east side, south of Bleecker Street (originally David Street), a one-story frame shack. 1932.

J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.

(1) Bleecker Street, east from Mercer Street.
NEG # 3759 June 23, 1936.
